article_title: Mexican cartels stealing billions from oil industry
article_text:
Mexico is in a battle to curb the control drug cartels have over the region next to shale fields along the Gulf Coast that could attract foreign investors.



The Associated Press reports that gangs are frequenting the region more and using sophisticated tactics.





ADVERTISEMENT

This year alone, cartels have drilled 2,481 illegal taps into state-owned pipelines, AP reports.Oil company Pemex estimates it has lost roughly 7.5 million barrels, which are worth $1.15 billion.Pemex director Emilio Lozoya said it is a "worrisome" trend.Mexico is projected to have the world's sixth-largest reserves of shale gas, and a majority of what's recoverable from that is located in a Gulf state bordering Texas.
